==Events==
*  [[69]] &ndash; [[Second Battle of Bedriacum]], forces under [[Antonius Primus]], the commander of the Danube armies, loyal to [[Vespasian]], defeat the forces of [[Roman Emperor|Emperor]] [[Vitellius]].
*[[1147]] &ndash; After a siege of 4 months crusader knights led by [[Afonso I of Portugal|Afonso Henriques]] reconquered [[Lisbon]].
*[[1260]] &ndash; The [[Cathedral of Chartres]] is dedicated in the presence of King [[Louis IX of France]]; the cathedral is now a [[UNESCO]] [[World Heritage Site]].
*  1260   &ndash; [[Qutuz|Saif ad-Din Qutuz]], [[Mamluk Sultanate (Cairo)|Mamluk]] sultan of [[Egypt]], is [[List of assassinated people|assassinated]] by [[Baibars]], who seizes power for himself.
*[[1360]] &ndash; The [[Treaty of Brétigny]] is ratified at [[Calais]], marking the end of the first phase of the [[Hundred Years' War]].
*[[1590]] &ndash; [[John White (colonist and artist)|John White]], the governor of the second [[Roanoke Colony]], returns to England after an unsuccessful search for the "lost" colonists.
*[[1648]] &ndash; The [[Peace of Westphalia]] is signed, marking the end of the [[Thirty Years' War]].
*[[1795]] &ndash; [[Partitions of Poland]]: The [[Polish-Lithuanian Commonwealth]] is completely divided among [[Austria]], [[Prussia]], and [[Russia]].
*[[1812]] &ndash; [[Napoleonic Wars]]: The [[Battle of Maloyaroslavets]] takes place near [[Moscow]].
*[[1851]] &ndash; [[William Lassell]], discovers the moons [[Umbriel (moon)|Umbriel]], and [[Ariel (moon)|Ariel]], orbiting [[Uranus]].
*[[1857]] &ndash; [[Sheffield F.C.]], the world's oldest association football club still in operation, is founded in [[Sheffield]], [[England]].
*[[1861]] &ndash; The [[First Transcontinental Telegraph]] line across the [[United States]] is completed, spelling the end for the 18-month-old [[Pony Express]].
*[[1901]] &ndash; [[Annie Edson Taylor]] becomes the first person to go over [[Niagara Falls]], in a barrel.
*[[1911]] &ndash; [[Orville Wright]], remains in the air 9 minutes and 45 seconds in a [[Wright Glider]], at [[Kill Devil Hills, North Carolina]].
*[[1912]] &ndash; [[First Balkan War]]: The [[Battle of Kumanovo]] concludes with the [[Kingdom of Serbia|Serbian]] victory.
*[[1917]] &ndash; [[Battle of Caporetto]]; [[Italy]] suffers a catastrophic defeat by the forces of [[Austria-Hungary]] and [[Germany]] on the [[Austria|Austro]]-[[Italy|Italian]] front of [[World War I]] (lasts until 19 November - also called Twelfth Battle of the Isonzo).
*[[1926]] &ndash; [[Harry Houdini]]'s last performance, which is at the [[Garrick Theatre]] in [[Detroit]], [[Michigan]].
*[[1929]] &ndash; "[[Wall Street Crash 1929|Black Thursday]]" [[stock market crash]] on the [[New York Stock Exchange]].
*[[1930]] &ndash; A bloodless [[coup d'état]] in [[Brazil]] ousts [[Washington Luís Pereira de Sousa]], the last [[List of Presidents of Brazil|President]] of the [[History of Brazil (1889-1930)|First Republic]]. [[Getúlio Dornelles Vargas]] is then installed as "provisional president."
*[[1931]] &ndash; The [[George Washington Bridge]] opens to public traffic.
*[[1943]] &ndash; The [[Azad Hind|Provisional Government of Free India]] formally declared war on Britain and the United States of America. 
*[[1944]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: The [[Japan]]ese [[aircraft carrier]] ''[[Japanese aircraft carrier Zuikaku|Zuikaku]]'' and the battleship ''[[Japanese battleship Musashi|Musashi]]'' are sunk by American aircraft in the [[Battle of Leyte Gulf]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; Founding of the [[United Nations]].
*[[1946]] &ndash; A camera on board the [[V-2 No. 13]] rocket takes the first photograph of earth from outer space.
*[[1947]] &ndash; [[Walt Disney]] testifies before the [[House Un-American Activities Committee]], naming Disney employees he believes to be [[communist]]s.
*[[1949]] &ndash; The [[cornerstone]] of the [[United Nations Headquarters]] is laid.
*[[1954]] &ndash; [[Dwight D. Eisenhower]] pledges [[United States]] support to [[South Vietnam]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; The [[USAF]] starts the [[X-20 Dyna-Soar]] program.
*[[1960]] &ndash; [[Nedelin catastrophe]]: An [[R-16 (missile)|R-16]] [[ballistic missile]] explodes on the launch pad at the [[Soviet Union]]'s [[Baikonur Cosmodrome]] space facility, killing over 100. Among the dead is Field Marshal Mitrofan Nedelin, whose death is reported to have occurred in a plane crash
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Northern Rhodesia]] gains independence from the [[United Kingdom]] and becomes the [[Zambia|Republic of Zambia]] (Southern [[Rhodesia]] remained a colony until the next year, with the [[Unilateral Declaration of Independence]])
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Yom Kippur War]] ends.
*[[1977]] &ndash; [[Veterans Day (United States)|Veterans Day]] is observed on the fourth Monday in October for the seventh and last time.  (The holiday is once again observed on [[November 11]] beginning the following year.)
*[[1980]] &ndash; The government of [[Poland]] legalizes the [[Solidarity (Polish trade union)|Solidarity trade union]]. 
*[[1986]] &ndash; [[Nezar Hindawi]] is sentenced to 45 years in prison, the longest sentence handed down by a British court, for the attempted bombing on an [[El Al]] flight at [[Heathrow]]. After the verdict, the [[United Kingdom]] breaks diplomatic relations with [[Syria]], claiming that Hindawi is helped by Syrian officials.
*[[1990]] &ndash; Italian prime minister [[Giulio Andreotti]] reveals to the Italian parliament the existence of [[Operation Gladio|Gladio]], the Italian "[[stay-behind]]" clandestine paramilitary [[NATO]] army, which was implicated in [[false flag]] terrorist attacks implicating communists and anarchists as part of the [[strategy of tension]] from the late 1960s to early 1980s.
*[[1992]] &ndash; The [[Toronto Blue Jays]] become the first [[Major League Baseball]] team based outside the [[United States]] to win the [[World Series]].
*[[1998]] &ndash; Launch of [[Deep Space 1]] [[comet]]/[[asteroid]] mission
*[[2002]] &ndash; Police arrest [[spree killer]]s [[John Allen Muhammad]] and [[Lee Boyd Malvo]], ending the [[Beltway sniper attacks]] in the area around [[Washington, DC]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; [[Concorde]] makes its last commercial [[flight]].
*[[2004]] &ndash; [[Arsenal Football Club]] loses to [[Manchester United F.C.|Manchester United]], ending a row of unbeaten matches at 49 matches, which is the record in the [[Premier League]].
*[[2005]] &ndash; [[Hurricane Wilma]] makes landfall in [[Effects of Hurricane Wilma in Florida|Florida]] resulting in 35 direct 26 indirect fatalities and causing $20.6B USD in damage.
*[[2007]] &ndash; [[Chang'e 1]], the first satellite in the [[Chinese Lunar Exploration Program]], is launched from [[Xichang Satellite Launch Center]].
*[[2008]] &ndash; "[[Stock market crash#Bloody Friday|Bloody Friday]]" saw many of the world's [[stock exchange]]s experience the worst declines in their history, with drops of around 10% in most indices.
